trans-unit.source: Authenticating a Service Principal with Azure Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Authenticating a Service Principal with Azure Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: Describes how to grant access to a Service Principal through role-based access control and authenticate it. Shows how to perform these tasks with PowerShell and Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to grant access to a Service Principal through role-based access control and authenticate it. Shows how to perform these tasks with PowerShell and Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to permit a service principal (such as an automated process, application, or service) to access other resources in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to permit a service principal (such as an automated process, application, or service) to access other resources in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: With Azure Resource Manager, you can use role-based access control to grant permitted actions to a service principal, and authenticate that service principal.
trans-unit.target: With Azure Resource Manager, you can use role-based access control to grant permitted actions to a service principal, and authenticate that service principal.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use PowerShell and Azure CLI to assign a role to service prinicpal and authenticate the serivce principal.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use PowerShell and Azure CLI to assign a role to service prinicpal and authenticate the serivce principal.

trans-unit.source: It shows how to authenticate with either a user name and password or a certificate.
trans-unit.target: It shows how to authenticate with either a user name and password or a certificate.

trans-unit.source: You can use either Azure PowerShell or Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows.
trans-unit.target: You can use either Azure PowerShell or Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have Azure PowerShell installed, see <linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have Azure PowerShell installed, see <linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have Azure CLI installed, see <linkText>Install and Configure the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have Azure CLI installed, see <linkText>Install and Configure the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory (AAD) - an identity and access management service for the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory (AAD) - an identity and access management service for the cloud.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>What is Azure active Directory</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>What is Azure active Directory</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Service Principal - An instance of an application in a directory that needs to access other resources.
trans-unit.target: Service Principal - An instance of an application in a directory that needs to access other resources.

trans-unit.source: AD Application - Directory record that identifies an application to AAD.
trans-unit.target: AD Application - Directory record that identifies an application to AAD.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Basics of Authentication in Azure AD</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Basics of Authentication in Azure AD</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will perform the steps to create a service principal for an Azure Active Directory application, assign a role to the service principal, and authenticate as the service principal by providing the application identifier and password.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will perform the steps to create a service principal for an Azure Active Directory application, assign a role to the service principal, and authenticate as the service principal by providing the application identifier and password.

trans-unit.source: Switch to Azure Resource Manager mode and sign in to your account.
trans-unit.target: Switch to Azure Resource Manager mode and sign in to your account.

trans-unit.source: Create a new AAD Application by running the New-AzureADApplication command.
trans-unit.target: Create a new AAD Application by running the New-AzureADApplication command.

trans-unit.source: Provide a display name for your application, the URI to a page that describes your application (the link is not verified), the URIs that identify your application, and the password for your application identity.
trans-unit.target: Provide a display name for your application, the URI to a page that describes your application (the link is not verified), the URIs that identify your application, and the password for your application identity.

trans-unit.source: Examine the new application object.
trans-unit.target: Examine the new application object.

trans-unit.source: The ApplicationId property is needed for creating service principals, role assignments and acquiring JWT tokens.
trans-unit.target: The ApplicationId property is needed for creating service principals, role assignments and acquiring JWT tokens.

trans-unit.source: Create a service principal for your application.
trans-unit.target: Create a service principal for your application.

trans-unit.source: You have now created a service principal in the directory, but the service does not have any permissions or scope assigned.
trans-unit.target: You have now created a service principal in the directory, but the service does not have any permissions or scope assigned.

trans-unit.source: You will need to explicitly grant the service principal permissions to perform operations at some scope.
trans-unit.target: You will need to explicitly grant the service principal permissions to perform operations at some scope.

trans-unit.source: Grant the service principal permissions on your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Grant the service principal permissions on your subscription.

trans-unit.source: In this sample you will grant the service principal the permission to Read all resources in the subscription.
trans-unit.target: In this sample you will grant the service principal the permission to Read all resources in the subscription.

trans-unit.source: For the ServicePrincipalName parameter, provie either the ApplicationId or the IdentifierUris that you used when creating the application.
trans-unit.target: For the ServicePrincipalName parameter, provie either the ApplicationId or the IdentifierUris that you used when creating the application.

trans-unit.source: For more information on role-based access control, see <linkText>Managing and Auditing Access to Resources</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information on role-based access control, see <linkText>Managing and Auditing Access to Resources</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the subscription in which the role assignment was created.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the subscription in which the role assignment was created.

trans-unit.source: This subscription will be used later to get the TenantId of the tenant that the service principal's role assignment resides in.
trans-unit.target: This subscription will be used later to get the TenantId of the tenant that the service principal's role assignment resides in.

trans-unit.source: If you created the role assignment in a subscription other than the currently selected subscription, you can specify the SubscriptoinId or SubscriptionName parameters to retrive a different subscription.
trans-unit.target: If you created the role assignment in a subscription other than the currently selected subscription, you can specify the SubscriptoinId or SubscriptionName parameters to retrive a different subscription.

trans-unit.source: Create a new PSCredential object which contains your credentials by running the Get-Credential command.
trans-unit.target: Create a new PSCredential object which contains your credentials by running the Get-Credential command.

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted you to enter your credentials.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted you to enter your credentials.

trans-unit.source: For the user name, use the ApplicationId or IdentifierUris that you used when creating the application.
trans-unit.target: For the user name, use the ApplicationId or IdentifierUris that you used when creating the application.

trans-unit.source: For the password, use the one you specified when creating the account.
trans-unit.target: For the password, use the one you specified when creating the account.

trans-unit.source: Use the credentials that you entered as an input to the Add-AzureAccount cmdlet, which will sign the service principal in:
trans-unit.target: Use the credentials that you entered as an input to the Add-AzureAccount cmdlet, which will sign the service principal in:

trans-unit.source: You should now be authenticated as the service principal for the AAD application that you created.
trans-unit.target: You should now be authenticated as the service principal for the AAD application that you created.

trans-unit.source: To authenticate from an application, include the following .NET code.
trans-unit.target: To authenticate from an application, include the following .NET code.

trans-unit.source: After retrieving the token, you can access resources in the subscription.
trans-unit.target: After retrieving the token, you can access resources in the subscription.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will perform the steps to create a service principal for an Azure Active Directory application, assign a role to the service principal, and authenticate as the service principal by providing a certificate.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will perform the steps to create a service principal for an Azure Active Directory application, assign a role to the service principal, and authenticate as the service principal by providing a certificate.

trans-unit.source: This topic assumes you have been issued a certificate.
trans-unit.target: This topic assumes you have been issued a certificate.

trans-unit.source: It shows two ways to work with certificates - key credentials and key values.
trans-unit.target: It shows two ways to work with certificates - key credentials and key values.

trans-unit.source: You can use either approach.
trans-unit.target: You can use either approach.

trans-unit.source: First, you must set up some values in PowerShell that you will use later when creating the application.
trans-unit.target: First, you must set up some values in PowerShell that you will use later when creating the application.

trans-unit.source: Switch to Azure Resource Manager mode and sign in to your account.
trans-unit.target: Switch to Azure Resource Manager mode and sign in to your account.

trans-unit.source: For both approaches, create an X509Certificate object from your certificate and retrieve the key value.
trans-unit.target: For both approaches, create an X509Certificate object from your certificate and retrieve the key value.

trans-unit.source: Use the path to your certificate and the password for that certificate.
trans-unit.target: Use the path to your certificate and the password for that certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are using key credentials, create the key credentials object and sets its value to the $keyValue from the previous step.
trans-unit.target: If you are using key credentials, create the key credentials object and sets its value to the $keyValue from the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Create an application in the directory.
trans-unit.target: Create an application in the directory.

trans-unit.source: The first command shows how to use key values.
trans-unit.target: The first command shows how to use key values.

trans-unit.source: Or, use the second example to assign key credentials.
trans-unit.target: Or, use the second example to assign key credentials.

trans-unit.source: Examine the new application object.
trans-unit.target: Examine the new application object.

trans-unit.source: The ApplicationId property is needed for creating service principals, role assignments and acquiring JWT tokens.
trans-unit.target: The ApplicationId property is needed for creating service principals, role assignments and acquiring JWT tokens.

trans-unit.source: Create a service principal for your application.
trans-unit.target: Create a service principal for your application.

trans-unit.source: You have now created a service principal in the directory, but the service does not have any permissions or scope assigned.
trans-unit.target: You have now created a service principal in the directory, but the service does not have any permissions or scope assigned.

trans-unit.source: You will need to explicitly grant the service principal permissions to perform operations at some scope.
trans-unit.target: You will need to explicitly grant the service principal permissions to perform operations at some scope.

trans-unit.source: Grant the service principal permissions on your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Grant the service principal permissions on your subscription.

trans-unit.source: In this sample you will grant the service principal the permission to Read all resources in the subscription.
trans-unit.target: In this sample you will grant the service principal the permission to Read all resources in the subscription.

trans-unit.source: For the ServicePrincipalName parameter, provie either the ApplicationId or the IdentifierUris that you used when creating the application.
trans-unit.target: For the ServicePrincipalName parameter, provie either the ApplicationId or the IdentifierUris that you used when creating the application.

trans-unit.source: For more information on role-based access control, see <linkText>Managing and Auditing Access to Resources</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information on role-based access control, see <linkText>Managing and Auditing Access to Resources</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: To authenticate from an application, include the following .NET code.
trans-unit.target: To authenticate from an application, include the following .NET code.

trans-unit.source: After retrieving the client, you can access resources in the subscription.
trans-unit.target: After retrieving the client, you can access resources in the subscription.

trans-unit.source: You will start by creating a service principal.
trans-unit.target: You will start by creating a service principal.

trans-unit.source: To do this we must use create an application in the directory.
trans-unit.target: To do this we must use create an application in the directory.

trans-unit.source: This section will walk through creating a new application in the directory.
trans-unit.target: This section will walk through creating a new application in the directory.

trans-unit.source: Switch to Azure Resource Manager mode and sign in to your account.
trans-unit.target: Switch to Azure Resource Manager mode and sign in to your account.

trans-unit.source: Create a new AAD Application by running the azure ad app create command.
trans-unit.target: Create a new AAD Application by running the azure ad app create command.

trans-unit.source: Provide a display name for your application, the URI to a page that describes your application (the link is not verified), the URIs that identify your application, and the password for your application identity.
trans-unit.target: Provide a display name for your application, the URI to a page that describes your application (the link is not verified), the URIs that identify your application, and the password for your application identity.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD application is returned.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD application is returned.

trans-unit.source: The ApplicationId property is needed for creating service principals, role assignments and acquiring JWT tokens.
trans-unit.target: The ApplicationId property is needed for creating service principals, role assignments and acquiring JWT tokens.

trans-unit.source: Create a service principal for your application.
trans-unit.target: Create a service principal for your application.

trans-unit.source: Provide the application id that was returned in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Provide the application id that was returned in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: The new service principal is returned.
trans-unit.target: The new service principal is returned.

trans-unit.source: The Object Id is needed when granting permissions.
trans-unit.target: The Object Id is needed when granting permissions.

trans-unit.source: You have now created a service principal in the directory, but the service does not have any permissions or scope assigned.
trans-unit.target: You have now created a service principal in the directory, but the service does not have any permissions or scope assigned.

trans-unit.source: You will need to explicitly grant the service principal permissions to perform operations at some scope.
trans-unit.target: You will need to explicitly grant the service principal permissions to perform operations at some scope.

trans-unit.source: Grant the service principal permissions on your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Grant the service principal permissions on your subscription.

trans-unit.source: In this sample you will grant the service principal the permission to Read all resources in the subscription.
trans-unit.target: In this sample you will grant the service principal the permission to Read all resources in the subscription.

trans-unit.source: For the ServicePrincipalName parameter, provie either the ApplicationId or the IdentifierUris that you used when creating the application.
trans-unit.target: For the ServicePrincipalName parameter, provie either the ApplicationId or the IdentifierUris that you used when creating the application.

trans-unit.source: For more information on role-based access control, see <linkText>Managing and Auditing Access to Resources</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information on role-based access control, see <linkText>Managing and Auditing Access to Resources</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Determine the TenantId of the tenant that the service principal's role assignment resides by listing the accounts and looking for the TenantId property in the output.
trans-unit.target: Determine the TenantId of the tenant that the service principal's role assignment resides by listing the accounts and looking for the TenantId property in the output.

trans-unit.source: Sign-in using the service principal as your identity.
trans-unit.target: Sign-in using the service principal as your identity.

trans-unit.source: For the user name, use the ApplicationId that you used when creating the application.
trans-unit.target: For the user name, use the ApplicationId that you used when creating the application.

trans-unit.source: For the password, use the one you specified when creating the account.
trans-unit.target: For the password, use the one you specified when creating the account.

trans-unit.source: You should now be authenticated as the service principal for the AAD application that you created.
trans-unit.target: You should now be authenticated as the service principal for the AAD application that you created.

trans-unit.source: For an overivew of role-based access control, see <linkText>Managing and Auditing Access to Resources</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For an overivew of role-based access control, see <linkText>Managing and Auditing Access to Resources</linkText><title></title>
